Class Indexing

  • java.lang.Object
    • Indexing

  • public class Indexing
extends java.lang.Object
    Indexes reviews from text file and guesses the score of user inputed reviews
    Version:
    2017.12.04
    Author:
    Steven

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Indexing()
      constructor method that initializes tree

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScore(java.lang.String s, int x)
      O(log n) assigns a score to a string and adds it to the binary tree; this method is called by parseWords to add words to the tree
      WordScores findString(java.lang.String x, BinaryNode<WordScores> node)
      checks if a node already exists with string "x" used by addScore to determine whether to add new node or to update an existing one
      void parseWords(java.lang.String[] arr)
      O(n log n) Takes in an array of strings Assigns the score of the line to each word after the first word (which is the score) Checks if each word already exists in the tree If the word does not exist, it is inserted such that the tree is alphabetically sorted Otherwise, the occurrence count of the word is increased by one
      double reviewScore(java.lang.String s)
      O(n log n) takes user input for a movie review breaks up the words and adds; if the score for a word is -1, it makes no change to the score
      double scoreWord(java.lang.String s)
      O(log n) finds a specified word and returns its average score; if the string does not exist, then return -1

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Indexing

        public Indexing()
        constructor method that initializes tree

    • Method Detail

      • addScore

        public void addScore(java.lang.String s,
                     int x)
        O(log n) assigns a score to a string and adds it to the binary tree; this method is called by parseWords to add words to the tree
        Parameters:
        s - String to add
        x - Score to add

      • findString

        public WordScores findString(java.lang.String x,
                             BinaryNode<WordScores> node)
        checks if a node already exists with string "x" used by addScore to determine whether to add new node or to update an existing one
        Parameters:
        x - string to search for
        node - root node
        Returns:
        the existing node or null

      • parseWords

        public void parseWords(java.lang.String[] arr)
        O(n log n) Takes in an array of strings Assigns the score of the line to each word after the first word (which is the score) Checks if each word already exists in the tree If the word does not exist, it is inserted such that the tree is alphabetically sorted Otherwise, the occurrence count of the word is increased by one
        Parameters:
        arr - string array input

      • scoreWord

        public double scoreWord(java.lang.String s)
        O(log n) finds a specified word and returns its average score; if the string does not exist, then return -1
        Parameters:
        s - the word score to find
        Returns:
        the average score

      • reviewScore

        public double reviewScore(java.lang.String s)
        O(n log n) takes user input for a movie review breaks up the words and adds; if the score for a word is -1, it makes no change to the score
        Parameters:
        s - the string input from the user
        Returns:
        the average score of the review based on scores assigned to words the user inputed that have already been used before
